p: There were six ELISA-positive animals/PCR-negative animals. These results may indicate subclinical infection, recovered animals or animals infected with an antigenically cross-reactive herpesvirus. Subclinical infection of cattle with SA-MCF has been reported previously [ 16, 31]. However a previous serosurvey for WA-MCF in Tanzania only detected 1% seropositive cattle [ 32]. The role of subclinically infected animals in the epidemiology of WA-MCF in east Africa warrants further investigation.
